sentences: Jutud kontrollimisest tõstavad poistel vägisi südame kurku
translation: makes one's heart rise to the throat
makes one very frightened or anxious
context: The word 'tõuseb' is a third-person singular present form of the verb 'tõusma' (to rise). In this context, it refers to the physical sensation of fear or anxiety where one feels their heart rising up into their throat. This is an idiom describing intense fright or nervousness. The word can appear in constructions like 'südant kurku tõstma' (to raise heart to throat) and 'süda on kurgus' (heart is in throat), both expressing extreme fear or anxiety.
